result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:39 AM Defendant Sheri L. Ackerman in court.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests an attorney. Court explain procedures. Court will reserve on the motion and reset to follow along with 22CM203. Court will allow Defendant to call in.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sheri L. Ackerman
Current: 950 S Main St #B10, River Falls, WI 54022 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2022)
Prior: W7909 STH 29, River Falls, WI 54022
Order to Revoke  (Deferred Judgment of Conviction)
to Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction filed by DA Hatch
to Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction filed by DA Hatch

10:03 AM Defendant Sheri L. Ackerman in court.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: guilty to charge with 1 year DJOC w/terms and conditions.   Victim's rights are in compliance. Defendant agrees.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights and right to have an attorney.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights and waives her right to have an attorney.  Defendant  pleas guilty to charge.  Court finds Defendant is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights and right to have an attorney. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty of charge. DA Hatch addresses sentencing argument.   Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 1 year DJOC. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Defendant to remain until handed a copy of signed DJOC. 10:18
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:32 PM Defendant Sheri L. Ackerman in court via phon.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court: this matter will be reset. DA Hatch: agreement with diversion program. Reset in a couple weeks. Court goes over Defendant's right to have an attorney.  Court resets plea/sentencing. Defendant must appear in person. 3:37  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH T.J.A.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

3:07 PM Defendant Sheri L. Ackerman appears pro se from Jail via video, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DE enters NG. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $1,000.00 SIBS w/condition of NAC w/T.J.A, AS, NTE, no objection. Court so orders. Victim does not want the charges but would like his mother to know he loves her. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:13 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
